locations.name: Alford-Montgomery Hall
locations.description: Alford-Montgomery Hall (often called Al-Monty) in the Student Village North area of Central is named for two former Central students who both loved music and lost their lives in the service of their country during World War II.

locations.name: Anderson Hall
locations.description: Anderson is an attractive option for students who prefer apartment living for the academic school year but do not wish to remain on campus over the Summer.

locations.name: Aquatic Center
locations.description: The Aquatic Center at CWU offers an array of programs and activities designed to accommodate learning, recreational swimming, and competitive swimming needs.

locations.name: Avation Training Center
locations.address: Central Washington University Aviation Training Center, 807 Elmview Rd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: The Aviation Training Center (ATC) serves as the venue for some of our aviation classes and houses our advanced flight simulators.

locations.name: Barge Hall
locations.description: Barge Hall is the oldest building on the CWU campus. Barge is home to campus leadership, as well as the Civil Rights Compliance Office and the Office of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusivity.

locations.name: Barto Hall
locations.description: Located in central campus near the Student Union and Recreation Center, Barto offers an easy commute to classes, all the activities in the SURC and the main dining center on campus. Nearby, students can find lighted outdoor handball courts, half-court basketball courts, volleyball nets, and large lawn areas for fun activities or relaxation.

locations.name: Beck Hall
locations.address: Beck Hall, 833-899 E 11th Ave, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Beck Hall is one of our six traditional residence halls that make up the Bassetties complex which houses first year students. Nearby, students can find lighted outdoor handball, half-court basketball courts, and large lawn areas for fun activities or relaxation.

locations.name: Black Hall
locations.description: Originally constructed in 1960, was named to honor George H. Black, who served as the fourth principal of Washington State Normal School before it became Central Washington University.

locations.name: Bouillon Hall
locations.address: Bouillon Hall, N Walnut St, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Bouillon Hall is here to help you. From Admissions and Student Financial Services to our Veterans Center and Registrar, if you have questions or need support, Bouillon is a great place to start.

locations.name: Breeze Thru Caf
locations.address: 700 E Dean Nicholson Blvd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Located in the skywalk between Michaelsen and Randall Hall, Breeze Thru Caf  is the perfect location for your quick coffee or snack. Choose from the many hot and cold beverages.

locations.name: Brook Lane Village Apartments
locations.description: Brooklane Village is located to the northeast of campus and houses a mix of single students and students with families. These apartments are about a 15 minute walk from campus.

locations.name: Brooks library
locations.address: E Dean Nicholson Blvd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: The Brooks Library holds a vast collection of books, academic journals, multimedia resources and even a fax machine. Whether you are looking for a quiet study space, research assistance, or access to a computer lab, the Brooks Library is the place to go.

locations.name: Button Hall
locations.description: Button Hall is home to Central's Housing and Residence Life office staff and administration.

locations.name: Carmody-Munro Hall
locations.description: Carmody-Munro Apartments are located on North campus in Carmody-Munro Hall. These microstudio apartments are furnished and are all single rooms. Furnishings include a bed, desk, chair, wardrobe, and microfridge. Residents will have access to a community kitchen, laundry room, study areas, and lounges. All rooms have access to community restrooms.

locations.name: Cat Trax East
locations.description: Cat Trax East offers a range of beverages and serves Caffe Vita Coffee, as well as all-natural Freshens Smoothies.

locations.name: Cat Trax West & Cats Market
locations.description: Cat Trax West offers a range of hot and cold beverages and serves Caffe Vita, Seattle's leading independent roasters. This location also includes Cats Market, a one-stop-shop for all your convenience needs.

locations.name: Central Marketplace
locations.description: As a CWU dining hub, Central Marketplace has something to satisfy every craving, offering a range of culinary options to choose from.

locations.name: Coach's Coffee House
locations.description: Named after a beloved faculty member from the Music Department, Coach's Coffee House is a favorite destination for students, faculty, and staff to pick up a hot or cold beverage between classes.

locations.name: Davies Hall
locations.address: Davies Hall, 913 E 11th Ave, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Davies Hall is one of our six traditional residence halls that make up the Bassetties Complex. This hall is for sophomore students and above and offers all single rooms.

locations.name: Dean Hall
locations.description: Built in 1968, Dean Hall was the beginning of our science neighborhood at CWU. Dean was remodeled and modernized in 2008, becoming the university s first Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) certified building.

locations.name: Discovery Hall
locations.description: Opened in 2016, Discovery Hall is home to many of our science programs and labs to facilitate your learning experience.

locations.name: Dougmore Hall
locations.address: 401 E Dean Nicholson Blvd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Dugmore is equipped with both communal and suite style bathrooms, study rooms, laundry rooms on each floor, and a communal kitchen on the first floor. Dugmore is located at the North East end of campus close to the library and Northside Commons.

locations.name: Early Childhood Learning Center
locations.description: The Early Childhood Learning Center (ECLC) provides childcare services and an educational curriculum to serve the needs of young children.

locations.name: Farrell Hall
locations.description: Farrell Hall was built between 1973 as part of what was originally known as the Library Complex. The structure was named for Corrine Farrell, an alumna and former CWU research professor.

locations.name: Flight Instructor Office Building
locations.address: 1105 W Bowers Rd, Ellensburg, WA 98926, USA
locations.description: While not instructing aviation classes in Black Hall, this is where the aviation professors reside. It's a stuffy little office building, but it' home to them.

locations.name: Flight Training Center
locations.description: The Flight Training Center (FTC) is essential to our Aviation program at CWU. This is where the actual flight training takes place and where our airplanes and flight instructors are stationed to facilitate your learning experience.

locations.name: Getz-Shortz Apartments
locations.address: 702 N Ruby St, Ellensburg, WA 98926, USA
locations.description: Short Getz Apartments are in the Southwest corner of campus and offer unfurnished 1- and 2-bedroom units with options for both a parking lot and on-street parking. Short Getz residents are walking distance from downtown Ellensburg and enjoy close proximity to Shaw-Smyser Hall and convenient grocery shopping.

locations.name: Green Hall
locations.description: Green hall was once a regular small student apartment complex, but in 2017 Central's Outreach Community acquired the hall and turned it into a 'Haven House' a place where students recovering from substance dependency to live in an understanding community

locations.name: Greenhouse
locations.description: The Greenhouse facility is composed of four separate rooms, each room has a different environment: the Jungle Room, Research Room, Desert Room, and Tropical Room.

locations.name: Grupe Faculty Center
locations.description: The Grupe Faculty Center was built in 1961 and named after Mary Grupe, a teacher from the Washington State Normal School in 1897.

locations.name: Health Sciences Building
locations.description: The Health Sciences building rounds out the science community at CWU. This LEED-certified building, equipped with solar panels and state-of-the-art energy controls, is home to our Health Science programs.

locations.name: Hebeler Hall
locations.description: Hebeler Hall is named to honor Amanda Hebeler, who played an integral role in the teacher training programs at CWU from 1924 to 1956. One of our oldest buildings, built in 1939.

locations.name: Hitchcock Hall
locations.description: Located in central campus near the Student Union and Recreation Center, Hitchcock offers an easy commute to classes, all the activities in the SURC and the main dining center on campus. Nearby, students can find lighted outdoor handball courts, half-court basketball courts, and large lawn areas for fun activities or relaxation.

locations.name: Hogue Technology Building
locations.address: 44444 E Dean Nicholson Blvd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: The Hogue Technology Building is the home of our Engineering Technologies, Safety, and Construction (ETSC) Department. Newly renovated, Hogue is an industrial complex. With 18 different labs every program offers plenty of hands-on opportunities to produce industry-ready graduates.

locations.name: Holmes Dining Room
locations.description: Holmes Dining offers an array of culinary choices, catering to what you're in the mood for.

locations.name: Jimmy B's Caf
locations.description: Fuel your studies at Jimmy B's. Grab a drink or a bite to eat, and come study in the comfortable seating area. Conveniently located inside Brooks Library on the north side of campus.

locations.name: Jongeward Building
locations.description: Jongeward houses Facilities Management and the Capital Planning and Projects Department.

locations.name: Kamola Hall
locations.address: Kamola Hall, 501 E University Way, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Located on the south end of campus on University Way, Kamola is next to many of our academic buildings which offers an easy commute to classes and all the actives in the SURC. Kamola offers many unique room types, and large lounge areas make it easy to connect with other residents in the hall.

locations.name: Kennedy Hall
locations.address: Kennedy Hall, 1605 N Alder St, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Kennedy Hall is a student dormitory that no longer exists (or does it???)

locations.name: Lind Hall
locations.description: Built in 1946, Lind Hall is home to an array of programs. Near the center of the building is a 36-foot-tall Foucault pendulum that passes through an opening in the floors of the second story and a third-story penthouse.

locations.name: McConnell Hall
locations.description: McConnell Hall is the residence of the Theatre Arts Department and serves as a performing arts venue, open to students and the entire Ellensburg community. In 1979, the Milo Smith Theatre was added to the north end of the building, providing additional space to facilitate student needs.

locations.name: Mcintyre Music Building
locations.address: 906 E Dean Nicholson Blvd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: The McIntyre Music Building houses our renowned Music Department, serving as a hub for musical innovation and expression.

locations.name: Meisner Hall
locations.address: Meisner Hall, 911, 901 E 11th Ave, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Located in central campus near the Student Union and Recreation Center, Meisner offers an easy commute to classes, all the activities in the SURC and the main dining center on campus. Nearby, students can find lighted outdoor handball courts, half-court basketball courts, and large lawn areas for fun activities or relaxation.

locations.name: Michaelsen Hall
locations.address: E Dean Nicholson Blvd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Michaelsen Hall, named in honor of Helen Michaelsen, a home economics professor from 1937 to 1970, embodies the legacy of its namesake.

locations.name: Mitchell Hall
locations.description: Both the Human Resources Department and Financial Affairs and Operations are found in Mitchell Hall. Services include hiring, employee training, benefits, student employment and planning for retirement, as well as university business, financial planning, contracts and purchasing, accounting, and payroll.

locations.name: Moore Hall
locations.description: Suites in Moore include three single bedrooms that share a bathroom. Located in central campus near the Student Union and Recreation Center, Moore offers an easy commute to many academic building, all the actives in the SURC and the main dining center on campus

locations.name: Munson Hall
locations.description: Central Washington University offers residence hall-style lodging in Munson Hall during the summer months.

locations.name: Naneum Building
locations.description: Building occupied by Facilities Management Custodial Services.

locations.name: Nicholson Pavilion
locations.address: 715 E Dean Nicholson Blvd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Originally built in 1960, and renovated in 2008, Nicholson s cable-suspension design makes it one of the nation s most unique sports arenas. Home to Wildcat Athletics, Nicholson plays host to basketball and volleyball games, summer camps, big-name entertainers, and other large events. The building has a newly renovated weight training room for athletes, a field house, and locker room.

locations.name: North Hall
locations.address: North Hall, 1100 N Walnut St, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Located in central campus near the Student Union and Recreation Center, North offers an easy commute to many academic building, all the actives in the SURC and the main dining center on campus. Nearby, students can find a large lawn area for fun actives or relaxation.

locations.name: Northside Commons
locations.address: 405 E Dean Nicholson Blvd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Located within Northside Commons next to Dugmore Hall, Northside Caf  offers a selection of coffee and espresso drinks.

locations.name: Old Heating Plant
locations.description: The brick smokestack on CWU s Old Heat building was constructed in 1917 in New York, then moved to Washington and installed as a coal-fired steam-heat plant in 1946. The boilers in Old Heat were converted from coal to gas about 10 years later.

locations.name: Psychology Building
locations.description: The Psychology Building was built in 1972 and constructed in the Brutalist architectural style popular in the 60s. The Psychology Building is home to the Psychology Department.

locations.name: Public Saftey Building
locations.description: Find Police and Public Safety in the Public Safety Building. Also make sure to say hello to Facility dog, Archie, if you see him!

locations.name: Quigley Hall
locations.address: Sparks Hall, 998, 900 E 12th Ave, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Located in central campus near the Student Union and Recreation Center, Quigley offers an easy commute to classes, all the activities in the SURC and the main dining center on campus. Nearby, students can find lighted outdoor handball courts, half-court basketball courts, and large lawn areas for fun activities or relaxation.

locations.name: Randall Hall
locations.address: 44444 E Dean Nicholson Blvd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Home of the Department of Art + Design, Randall Hall has studios for: Ceramics, Graphic Design, Metalsmithing, Painting, Photography, and Wood Design

locations.name: Residence Life
locations.address: Sparks Hall, 900 W 12th Ave, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Here you'll find Residence Life, Orientation and Transitions, and Parent and Support Network Programs.

locations.name: Samuelson Building
locations.description: Renovated in 2018, Samuelson is made up of 17 high-tech classrooms, 11 computer labs, and 6 studios to create creative and complex online content.

locations.name: Science Building
locations.description: The Science Building is settled in the realm of science, providing labs and classrooms to support your learning. It is also home to various reptiles and aquatic creatures.

locations.name: Shaw-Smyser hall
locations.description: Shaw-Smyser is home to the College of Business. Programs in the College of Business offer internships. business simulations, collaborative research, community projects, industry competitions, and professional certifications.

locations.name: Sparks Hall
locations.address: Sparks Hall, 900 East 12th Avenue, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Located in central campus near the Student Union and Recreation Center, Sparks offers an easy commute to classes, all the activities in the SURC and the main dining center on campus. Nearby, students can find lighted outdoor handball courts, half-court basketball courts, and large lawn areas for fun activities or relaxation.

locations.name: Stephens-Whitney Hall
locations.address: Stephens-Whitney Hall, 1236, 1200 N Walnut St, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Each suite contains a single room, a double room, a shared bathroom, and a living room area. Located in central campus near the Student Union and Recreation Center, Stephens Whitney offers an easy commute to many academic buildings, all the actives in the SURC and the main dining center on campus. Nearby, students can find a patio and large lawn area next to the SURC for fun activities or relaxation.

locations.name: Student Health Services
locations.description: The Student Health Services building is located on campus and is for students who need general medical services.

locations.name: Student Union and Recreation Center
locations.description: Located in the center of campus, the Student Union and Recreation Center, more commonly know as the SURC, is more than 220,000 square feet. It's the largest building on campus and one of the first facilities of its kind to combine residential dining, bookstore, recreation and student life programs and services.

locations.name: Student Village
locations.description: Student Village Apartments are located on the North side of CWU s campus and close to Nicholson Pavilion, tennis courts, athletic fields and the North Village Caf .

locations.name: Sue Lombard Dining Room
locations.description: The Lombard Room in Sue Lombard Hall is a multi-use room that can fit up to 160 guests in a theater-style setup. The room has 2 built-in screens that drop down from the ceiling, and can be set up with a full AV cart including in-house sound.

locations.name: Sue Lombard Hall
locations.description: Located on the south end of campus on University Way and next to many of our academic buildings, Sue Lombard offers an easy commute to classes and all the actives in the SURC. Sue Lombard is a small community which makes it easy for residents to get to know their neighbors.

locations.name: Surplus Property Warehouse
locations.address: 1210 N B St, Ellensburg, WA 98926, USA
locations.description: The Surplus Property Warehouse is where you'll find the team responsible for holding surplus sales, managing surplus furniture and equipment, recycling materials, and handling abandoned property.

locations.name: The Bistro
locations.description: The Bistro offers hot and cold beverages, and well as baked goods and Bistro on the Go items, made fresh right here on campus. Also featuring Winegar's Ice Cream.

locations.name: The Village Coffee, Market, Grill
locations.description: The Village Coffee has plenty of seating and the longest hours of any caf  on campus, serving delicious Caffe Vita espresso until midnight. It's the perfect spot to study, or grab a bite from the grill or pick up full sized groceries from the market.

locations.name: Tomlinson Stadium
locations.description: CWU s home field, Tomlinson Stadium, supports our Division I Rugby teams and Division II Football team. Tomlinson Stadium was named to honor Wildcat football player, Jack Tomlinson.

locations.name: Wahle Apartment Complex
locations.description: Wahle Apartments are conveniently located in the Northwest corner of the CWU campus. Wahle residents enjoy close proximity to the Brooks Library, Psychology building, Purser Hall, Nicholson Pavilion and the Northside Commons Dining featuring Panda Express.

locations.name: Wendell Hill Hall A
locations.address: 905 E Dean Nicholson Blvd, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Wendell Hill Hall A is one of our two Wendell Hill residence halls with a modern set up and feel for our sophomore and up students. Nearby, students can find many outdoor recreation opportunities such as the tennis courts, basketball courts and field house. There is also a full-service coffee shop on the ground floor of Wendell B.

locations.name: Wendell Hill Hall B
locations.description: Located in the northern area of campus near the athletic center and many academic buildings, students can find many outdoor recreation opportunities such as the tennis courts, basketball courts and field house. There is also a full-service coffee shop on the ground floor.

locations.name: Wildcat Printing
locations.description: Wildcat Printing can handle your printing needs. Print posters, post cards, fliers, and programs with a variety of finishing options to choose from.

locations.name: Wilson Hall
locations.address: Wilson Hall, 709 E 11th Ave, Ellensburg, WA 98926
locations.description: Wilson houses first year students and provides residents easy access to the Wildcat Shop, Recreation Center, and Dining Services. Wilson offers amenities such as two lounges, two laundry rooms, two kitchens, and a small lobby upstairs for social events or studying.
